Path: docs/product-vision.md
 1	# Helly AI
 2	
 3	Helly is your friendly people management assistant. 
 4	
 5	This system supports team leads, managers, and people ops in managing feedback, performance, 1:1s, and goals with the help of lightweight AI agents. The goal is to create a modular, proactive "second brain" for people management — one that can plug into existing HR tools or stand alone.
 6	
 7	---
 8	
 9	## Strategic Vision
 10	
 11	- **Build as a platform**: The core logic, memory, and agent behavior should be system-agnostic — easily integrated into tools like Lattice, BambooHR, Leapsome, etc.
 12	- **Composable AI agents**: Each capability is managed by an autonomous agent (e.g., FeedbackAgent, FollowUpAgent) that can run standalone or be embedded via API/webhook.
 13	- **Pluggable architecture**: Slack/Teams bots, web widgets, REST/gRPC interfaces — focus on integration rather than full-stack replacement.
 14	
 15	---
 16	
 17	## Core Use Cases
 18	
 19	### 1. **Feedback Catalog on the Go**
 20	- Write feedback any time (voice, text, Slack, etc.)
 21	- System tags person, date, topic, and sentiment automatically
 22	- Stores feedback in an ongoing timeline ("performance catalog")
 23	
 24	**AI Role:**
 25	- Extracts themes and tags
 26	- Detects praise vs concern
 27	- Suggests reframing if tone is harsh
 28	- Connects feedback to goals or 1:1 agendas
 29	
 30	---
 31	
 32	### 2. **Proactive Follow-ups**
 33	- Detects silence or imbalance ("You haven’t said anything about Max in 2 months")
 34	- Prompts for check-ins based on gaps or negative trends
 35	
 36	**AI Role:**
 37	- FollowUpAgent monitors interaction frequency
 38	- Nudges manager with lightweight prompts
 39	- Tracks omissions, not just activity
 40	
 41	---
 42	
 43	### 3. **1:1 Agenda Management**
 44	- Drafts agendas from recent feedback, goals, and loose ends
 45	- Reminds about unresolved issues, team dynamics, or goal blockers
 46	- Generates actionable talking points
 47	
 48	**AI Role:**
 49	- OneOnOneAgent analyzes recent data
 50	- Highlights urgent or time-sensitive items
 51	- Suggests framing or priority
 52	
 53	---
 54	
 55	### 4. **Goal Setting & Tracking**
 56	- Create SMART goals, link to feedback and actions
 57	- Track updates passively (via feedback, performance data)
 58	- Get reminders when progress is stalled
 59	
 60	**AI Role:**
 61	- GoalAgent helps define clear, aligned objectives
 62	- Monitors goal staleness or drift
 63	- Suggests next actions based on historical behavior
 64	
 65	---
 66	
 67	## Technical Design Principles
 68	
 69	- **Event-driven agents** with persistent memory (DB + embeddings)
 70	- **Modular agents** with clear boundaries and APIs:
 71	 - `FeedbackAgent`
 72	 - `FollowUpAgent`
 73	 - `OneOnOneAgent`
 74	 - `GoalAgent`
 75	- **Context-aware RAG**: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for summarizing past feedback, goals, 1:1s
 76	- **Interoperable I/O**:
 77	 - Slack, Teams, Email, Mobile input
 78	 - Expose APIs and webhooks for HRIS and PM system integration
 79	
 80	---
 81	
 82	## Sample Prompts / Interactions
 83	
 84	- "Log feedback for Max: took great ownership of the roadmap."
 85	- "Who haven’t I talked about lately?"
 86	- "What should I discuss with Lisa tomorrow?"
 87	- "Remind me to follow up on Alex’s new goal next week."
 88	- "Summarize Julia’s Q2 performance."
 89	
 90	---
 91	
 92	## Future Features (TBD)
 93	
 94	- Timeline view per person with feedback, goals, and 1:1s
 95	- Sentiment heatmaps for teams
 96	- Voice-to-feedback input with tagging
 97	- Shared vs private notes toggle
 98	- HRIS sync (e.g., BambooHR, HiBob, Personio)
 99	- Exportable review packets
 100	
 101	---
 102	
 103	## What’s Next
 104	
 105	- Define MVP loop (e.g. FeedbackAgent + FollowUpAgent)
 106	- Build memory backend (structured + vector)
 107	- Ship as Slackbot or web extension first
 108	- Focus on *one tight loop* that shows agent value...
Path: docs/mvp.md
 1	
 2	# MVP for Helly AI
 3	
 4	## Product spec
 5	
 6	Everything in the MVP is API only. We are not building a UI.
 7	
 8	### Setting up a team
 9	
 10	As a manager I need to define my team members. A team member needs to
 11	- Have a name (e.g. Max Muster)
 12	- Have a role (e.g. Lead engineer)
 13	- Have a relationship with me (e.g. reports to me, peer)
 14	- Have a start date
 15	
 16	### Adding feedback
 17	
 18	As a manager I can add feedback for a team member. Feedback needs to
 19	- Describe a specific situation or a note to remember. Examples 
 20	 - "Max took great ownership of the roadmap."
 21	 - "This week I felt like Max was not very communicative. I think we should have a chat."
 22	 - "I just heard that Max is feeling a bit burnt out. I should touch on that topic in the next call"
 23	
 24	### Asking about a team member
 25	
 26	As a manager I can ask questions about a team member. Examples
 27	- "What should I discuss with Max tomorrow?"
 28	- "What is Max's performance like?"
 29	- "What should I do next with Max?"
 30	- "I want to draft a feedback document for Max. Help me create a structure."
 31	
 32	## Tech spec
 33	
 34	### Software App
 35	
 36	The "classic" app, meaning regular code w/o AI should be in a separate package /app.
 37	This will include
 38	- The REST API
 39	- Database for keeping the feedback entries
 40	
 41	Basically a simple CRUD app.
 42	
 43	Tech stack for the software app:
 44	- Kotlin
 45	- Spring Boot
 46	- PostgreSQL
 47	
 48	### AI App
 49	
 50	The AI app will be in a separate package /ai.
 51	This is a standalone python application with its own API. The software app will call this API to get the AI generated responses.
 52	
 53	On a regular basis (e.g. when a new feedback entry is added, or on a time schedule) all the feedback needs to be
 54	inserted into a vector database that allows semantic search and conversational QA.
 55	For now, we will wipe & re-insert all the feedback data whenever a change is made. We can have a simple api that allows
 56	us to insert all the feedback data for a team member at once.
 57	
 58	Important: The vector data needs to be filtered by team member (e.g. the ID) and time period, potentially more criteria later.
 59	Choose an appropriate pattern to make this possible.
 60	
 61	### Testing
 62	
 63	We want to have integration tests at first that allow us to verify the end-to-end flow while keeping the exact implementation flexible.
 64	This means: test on an API level. Only mock external calls. 
 65	We want to test the software and ai apps separately.
 66	
 67	When this MVP is completed, it should only have a small set of tests that verify that most important use cases.
 68	
 69	### General guidelines
 70	
 71	- Favour readability always. Follow the clean code principles.
 72	- Separate concerns. 
 73	- Always think API-first. Define a clear API contract and stick to it. The API must be business-oriented, no technical details....

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "docs/initial-prompt.md", "file_content": "## Helly.ai MVP \u2014 Design-First Agent Prompt (Interfaces & Abstractions Only)\n\nYou are an expert software architect and senior IC tasked with scaffolding the FIRST iteration of Helly.ai as specified in:\n- docs/product-vision.md (strategic vision, agent model)\n- docs/mvp.md (MVP product + tech spec)\n\nGoal of this iteration: produce clear interfaces/abstractions, API contracts, schemas, directory structure, and test scaffolds ONLY. Do NOT implement business logic. This pass is for design review and architecture alignment.\n\n---\n\n### Scope\nCreate two separable applications with clean boundaries:\n1) Software App (/app): Kotlin + Spring Boot + PostgreSQL\n - Expose REST API for teams, team members, feedback CRUD\n - Persist feedback\n - Forward \u201cask about a team member\u201d questions to the AI app via HTTP\n2) AI App (/ai): Python + FastAPI (API-only)\n - Endpoints for ingestion and query\n - Define RAG abstractions (vector store, embedder, pipeline) WITHOUT concrete implementations\n\nDo not build a UI. Everything is API-only.\n\n---\n\n### Non-Goals (for this iteration)\n- No business logic, no concrete integrations (Slack, HRIS, vector DB, LLM)\n- No migrations beyond minimal schema stubs\n- No auth/identity beyond placeholders\n- No infra/deployment scripts beyond simple run instructions\n\n---\n\n### Architectural Principles\n- API-first: Define OpenAPI specs and DTOs before code\n- Separation of concerns and clean boundaries between /app and /ai\n- Event-driven shape: model a FeedbackCreated event and an ingestion trigger (HTTP call), even if the first version uses a simple synchronous call\n- Replaceable adapters: vector store and embedding providers must be behind interfaces/protocols\n- Readable, minimal, testable scaffolds\n\n---\n\n### Deliverables (Checklist)\nProvide these artifacts as code + docs, with TODOs and NotImplemented placeholders:\n- Overall repository layout scaffold\n- OpenAPI specs for both services\n- Controller/route stubs, DTOs, validators, error models\n- Domain model (entities/value objects) and repository/service interfaces\n- Event model (FeedbackCreated) and an Application Port interface for publishing/handling\n- AI app protocols: VectorStore, Embedder, RAGPipeline, IngestionService, QueryService\n- Persistence interface definitions only (no DB code)\n- Configuration placeholders and environment variable contract\n- Integration test scaffolds for both services (API level; mock external calls)\n- Minimal READMEs per service: how to run tests and start a dev server\n\n---\n\n### Repository Structure to Create\n- /app (Kotlin, Spring Boot 3.x)\n - build.gradle.kts, settings.gradle.kts (placeholders ok)\n - src/main/kotlin/helly/app/\n - api/ (controllers)\n - application/ (use-cases, services, ports)\n - domain/ (entities, value objects, events)\n - infrastructure/ (adapters: http client to /ai only as interface + stub)\n - config/\n - src/main/resources/\n - src/test/kotlin/helly/app/ (integration tests)\n- /ai (Python 3.11+, FastAPI)\n - pyproject.toml or requirements.txt (placeholders ok)\n - helly_ai/\n - api/ (routers)\n - application/ (services)\n - domain/ (models)\n - infrastructure/ (adapters interfaces only)\n - config/\n - tests/ (integration tests)\n- /docs\n - initial-prompt.md (this file)\n - mvp.md, product-vision.md (given)\n\n---\n\n### Software App (/app) \u2014 API Contract (OpenAPI outline)\nBase path: /v1\n\nTeam Members\n- POST /team-members\n - Body: { name, role, relationship_to_manager, start_date }\n - Returns: TeamMemberDTO { id, ... }\n- GET /team-members/{id}\n- GET /team-members?search=\n\nFeedback\n- POST /feedback\n - Body: FeedbackCreateDTO { team_member_id, content, created_at? }\n - Behavior: persist; publish FeedbackCreated event; invoke AI ingestion sync endpoint for that member (through an application port; actual HTTP call stubbed)\n - Returns: FeedbackDTO { id, team_member_id, content, created_at }\n- GET /feedback?team_member_id=&from=&to=\n\nAsk (delegates to AI App)\n- POST /team-members/{id}/ask\n - Body: AskDTO { question, from?, to? }\n - Returns: AskResponseDTO { answer, citations?: [FeedbackRef] }\n - Implementation: controller -> application port -> stubbed AiClient; do not call a real server\n\nError Model\n- Problem+JSON style: { type, title, status, detail, instance }\n\nDTOs (Kotlin data classes)\n- TeamMemberDTO(id: UUID, name: String, role: String, relationshipToManager: String, startDate: LocalDate)\n- FeedbackDTO(id: UUID, teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant)\n- FeedbackCreateDTO(teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant?)\n- AskDTO(question: String, from: Instant?, to: Instant?)\n- AskResponseDTO(answer: String, citations: List<FeedbackRef>?)\n- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, createdAt: Instant, snippet: String)\n\nDomain Model (no JPA yet; simple classes/interfaces)\n- TeamMember(id, name, role, relationshipToManager, startDate)\n- Feedback(id, teamMemberId, content, createdAt)\n- Event: FeedbackCreated(id, teamMemberId, createdAt)\n\nPorts/Interfaces\n- TeamMemberRepository, FeedbackRepository (CRUD method signatures only)\n- AiClient (ask(teamMemberId, question, from?, to?) -> AskResponseDTO; ingestAll(teamMemberId, items))\n- EventPublisher (publish(event: FeedbackCreated))\n- Use-cases: FeedbackService.addFeedback(...), AskService.ask(...)\n\nTesting (integration scaffolds)\n- SpringBootTest with MockMvc/WebTestClient\n- Tests cover: create member -> add feedback -> POST ask (AiClient mocked)\n- External calls mocked via a TestConfiguration bean\n\n---\n\n### AI App (/ai) \u2014 API Contract (OpenAPI outline)\nBase path: /v1\n\nIngestion\n- POST /ingest/member-corpus\n - Body: IngestRequest { team_member_id: UUID, items: [FeedbackItem], from?: Instant, to?: Instant, wipe_existing: true }\n - Semantics: replace existing corpus for member (MVP behavior)\n - Response: 202 Accepted + operation id\n\nQuery\n- POST /query\n - Body: QueryRequest { team_member_id: UUID, question: String, from?: Instant, to?: Instant }\n - Response: QueryResponse { answer: String, citations: [FeedbackRef], meta?: { used_filters } }\n\nModels\n- FeedbackItem(id: UUID, content: String, created_at: Instant)\n- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, created_at: Instant, snippet: String)\n\nAbstractions/Protocols (Python typing.Protocol or ABC)\n- VectorStore\n - upsert_member_corpus(member_id: UUID, items: list[FeedbackItem], time_range?: (from, to)) -> None\n - query(member_id: UUID, text: str, time_range?: (from, to), k: int=10) -> list[FeedbackRef]\n- Embedder\n - embed_texts(texts: list[str]) -> list[list[float]]\n- RAGPipeline\n - ingest(member_id, items, time_range?) -> None\n - answer(member_id, question, time_range?) -> QueryResponse\n- IngestionService, QueryService: orchestrate via the above interfaces\n\nFiltering Strategy (design only)\n- Namespacing by team_member_id; time filters applied at query-time and/or precomputed shard keys; do not choose a concrete DB now\n\nTesting (integration scaffolds)\n- FastAPI TestClient (pytest) calling /ingest/member-corpus and /query\n- Provide fake/no-op implementations that raise NotImplementedError to ensure design compile-time integrity only\n\n---\n\n### Events & Integration Flow (Design Only)\n- On POST /feedback in /app: emit FeedbackCreated; application layer schedules/requests ingestion by calling AI App /ingest/member-corpus for that member (port method). Keep the call behind an interface; provide a stub implementation returning a fixed placeholder.\n\n---\n\n### Conventions & Guardrails\n- Kotlin 1.9+, Spring Boot 3.x; Python 3.11, FastAPI, Pydantic v2\n- Use clear package/module naming as shown above\n- All non-trivial methods contain TODO and throw UnsupportedOperationException (Kotlin) or raise NotImplementedError (Python)\n- No external network calls in tests\n- Favor clean code and readability; keep files small and cohesive\n\n---\n\n### Output Expectations\nSubmit a PR-ready scaffold with:\n- The directory structure and files\n- OpenAPI specs (YAML) for both services\n- Source files with interfaces, DTOs, controllers/routers stubs, and comments\n- Test folders with 1\u20132 integration test skeletons per service\n- README.md in /app and /ai explaining how to run tests and servers locally\n\nStop here. Do NOT implement business logic or concrete adapters. Surface any design questions as TODOs at top of relevant files.\n", "add_last_line_newline": true}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":4,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Task list updated successfully. "old_str_end_line_number_1": 1, "old_str_1": "", "new_str_1": "## Helly.ai MVP \u2014 Design-First Agent Prompt (Interfaces & Abstractions Only)\n\nYou are an expert software architect and senior IC tasked with scaffolding the FIRST iteration of Helly.ai as specified in:\n- docs/product-vision.md (strategic vision, agent model)\n- docs/mvp.md (MVP product + tech spec)\n\nGoal of this iteration: produce clear interfaces/abstractions, API contracts, schemas, directory structure, and test scaffolds ONLY. Do NOT implement business logic. This pass is for design review and architecture alignment.\n\n---\n\n### Scope\nCreate two separable applications with clean boundaries:\n1) Software App (/app): Kotlin + Spring Boot + PostgreSQL\n - Expose REST API for teams, team members, feedback CRUD\n - Persist feedback\n - Forward \u201cask about a team member\u201d questions to the AI app via HTTP\n2) AI App (/ai): Python + FastAPI (API-only)\n - Endpoints for ingestion and query\n - Define RAG abstractions (vector store, embedder, pipeline) WITHOUT concrete implementations\n\nDo not build a UI. Everything is API-only.\n\n---\n\n### Non-Goals (for this iteration)\n- No business logic, no concrete integrations (Slack, HRIS, vector DB, LLM)\n- No migrations beyond minimal schema stubs\n- No auth/identity beyond placeholders\n- No infra/deployment scripts beyond simple run instructions\n\n---\n\n### Architectural Principles\n- API-first: Define OpenAPI specs and DTOs before code\n- Separation of concerns and clean boundaries between /app and /ai\n- Event-driven shape: model a FeedbackCreated event and an ingestion trigger (HTTP call), even if the first version uses a simple synchronous call\n- Replaceable adapters: vector store and embedding providers must be behind interfaces/protocols\n- Readable, minimal, testable scaffolds\n\n---\n\n### Deliverables (Checklist)\nProvide these artifacts as code + docs, with TODOs and NotImplemented placeholders:\n- Overall repository layout scaffold\n- OpenAPI specs for both services\n- Controller/route stubs, DTOs, validators, error models\n- Domain model (entities/value objects) and repository/service interfaces\n- Event model (FeedbackCreated) and an Application Port interface for publishing/handling\n- AI app protocols: VectorStore, Embedder, RAGPipeline, IngestionService, QueryService\n- Persistence interface definitions only (no DB code)\n- Configuration placeholders and environment variable contract\n- Integration test scaffolds for both services (API level; mock external calls)\n- Minimal READMEs per service: how to run tests and start a dev server\n\n---\n\n### Repository Structure to Create\n- /app (Kotlin, Spring Boot 3.x)\n - build.gradle.kts, settings.gradle.kts (placeholders ok)\n - src/main/kotlin/helly/app/\n - api/ (controllers)\n - application/ (use-cases, services, ports)\n - domain/ (entities, value objects, events)\n - infrastructure/ (adapters: http client to /ai only as interface + stub)\n - config/\n - src/main/resources/\n - src/test/kotlin/helly/app/ (integration tests)\n- /ai (Python 3.11+, FastAPI)\n - pyproject.toml or requirements.txt (placeholders ok)\n - helly_ai/\n - api/ (routers)\n - application/ (services)\n - domain/ (models)\n - infrastructure/ (adapters interfaces only)\n - config/\n - tests/ (integration tests)\n- /docs\n - initial-prompt.md (this file)\n - mvp.md, product-vision.md (given)\n\n---\n\n### Software App (/app) \u2014 API Contract (OpenAPI outline)\nBase path: /v1\n\nTeam Members\n- POST /team-members\n - Body: { name, role, relationship_to_manager, start_date }\n - Returns: TeamMemberDTO { id, ... }\n- GET /team-members/{id}\n- GET /team-members?search=\n\nFeedback\n- POST /feedback\n - Body: FeedbackCreateDTO { team_member_id, content, created_at? }\n - Behavior: persist; publish FeedbackCreated event; invoke AI ingestion sync endpoint for that member (through an application port; actual HTTP call stubbed)\n - Returns: FeedbackDTO { id, team_member_id, content, created_at }\n- GET /feedback?team_member_id=&from=&to=\n\nAsk (delegates to AI App)\n- POST /team-members/{id}/ask\n - Body: AskDTO { question, from?, to? }\n - Returns: AskResponseDTO { answer, citations?: [FeedbackRef] }\n - Implementation: controller -> application port -> stubbed AiClient; do not call a real server\n\nError Model\n- Problem+JSON style: { type, title, status, detail, instance }\n\nDTOs (Kotlin data classes)\n- TeamMemberDTO(id: UUID, name: String, role: String, relationshipToManager: String, startDate: LocalDate)\n- FeedbackDTO(id: UUID, teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant)\n- FeedbackCreateDTO(teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant?)\n- AskDTO(question: String, from: Instant?, to: Instant?)\n- AskResponseDTO(answer: String, citations: List<FeedbackRef>?)\n- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, createdAt: Instant, snippet: String)\n\nDomain Model (no JPA yet; simple classes/interfaces)\n- TeamMember(id, name, role, relationshipToManager, startDate)\n- Feedback(id, teamMemberId, content, createdAt)\n- Event: FeedbackCreated(id, teamMemberId, createdAt)\n\nPorts/Interfaces\n- TeamMemberRepository, FeedbackRepository (CRUD method signatures only)\n- AiClient (ask(teamMemberId, question, from?, to?) -> AskResponseDTO; ingestAll(teamMemberId, items))\n- EventPublisher (publish(event: FeedbackCreated))\n- Use-cases: FeedbackService.addFeedback(...), AskService.ask(...)\n\nTesting (integration scaffolds)\n- SpringBootTest with MockMvc/WebTestClient\n- Tests cover: create member -> add feedback -> POST ask (AiClient mocked)\n- External calls mocked via a TestConfiguration bean\n\n---\n\n### AI App (/ai) \u2014 API Contract (OpenAPI outline)\nBase path: /v1\n\nIngestion\n- POST /ingest/member-corpus\n - Body: IngestRequest { team_member_id: UUID, items: [FeedbackItem], from?: Instant, to?: Instant, wipe_existing: true }\n - Semantics: replace existing corpus for member (MVP behavior)\n - Response: 202 Accepted + operation id\n\nQuery\n- POST /query\n - Body: QueryRequest { team_member_id: UUID, question: String, from?: Instant, to?: Instant }\n - Response: QueryResponse { answer: String, citations: [FeedbackRef], meta?: { used_filters } }\n\nModels\n- FeedbackItem(id: UUID, content: String, created_at: Instant)\n- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, created_at: Instant, snippet: String)\n\nAbstractions/Protocols (Python typing.Protocol or ABC)\n- VectorStore\n - upsert_member_corpus(member_id: UUID, items: list[FeedbackItem], time_range?: (from, to)) -> None\n - query(member_id: UUID, text: str, time_range?: (from, to), k: int=10) -> list[FeedbackRef]\n- Embedder\n - embed_texts(texts: list[str]) -> list[list[float]]\n- RAGPipeline\n - ingest(member_id, items, time_range?) -> None\n - answer(member_id, question, time_range?) -> QueryResponse\n- IngestionService, QueryService: orchestrate via the above interfaces\n\nFiltering Strategy (design only)\n- Namespacing by team_member_id; time filters applied at query-time and/or precomputed shard keys; do not choose a concrete DB now\n\nTesting (integration scaffolds)\n- FastAPI TestClient (pytest) calling /ingest/member-corpus and /query\n- Provide fake/no-op implementations that raise NotImplementedError to ensure design compile-time integrity only\n\n---\n\n### Events & Integration Flow (Design Only)\n- On POST /feedback in /app: emit FeedbackCreated; application layer schedules/requests ingestion by calling AI App /ingest/member-corpus for that member (port method). Keep the call behind an interface; provide a stub implementation returning a fixed placeholder.\n\n---\n\n### Conventions & Guardrails\n- Kotlin 1.9+, Spring Boot 3.x; Python 3.11, FastAPI, Pydantic v2\n- Use clear package/module naming as shown above\n- All non-trivial methods contain TODO and throw UnsupportedOperationException (Kotlin) or raise NotImplementedError (Python)\n- No external network calls in tests\n- Favor clean code and readability; keep files small and cohesive\n\n---\n\n### Output Expectations\nSubmit a PR-ready scaffold with:\n- The directory structure and files\n- OpenAPI specs (YAML) for both services\n- Source files with interfaces, DTOs, controllers/routers stubs, and comments\n- Test folders with 1\u20132 integration test skeletons per service\n- README.md in /app and /ai explaining how to run tests and servers locally\n\nStop here. Do NOT implement business logic or concrete adapters.  1	## Helly.ai MVP — Design-First Agent Prompt (Interfaces & Abstractions Only)
 2	
 3	You are an expert software architect and senior IC tasked with scaffolding the FIRST iteration of Helly.ai as specified in:
 4	- docs/product-vision.md (strategic vision, agent model)
 5	- docs/mvp.md (MVP product + tech spec)
 6	
 7	Goal of this iteration: produce clear interfaces/abstractions, API contracts, schemas, directory structure, and test scaffolds ONLY. Do NOT implement business logic. This pass is for design review and architecture alignment.
 8	
 9	---
 10	
 11	### Scope
 12	Create two separable applications with clean boundaries:
 13	1) Software App (/app): Kotlin + Spring Boot + PostgreSQL
 14	 - Expose REST API for teams, team members, feedback CRUD
 15	 - Persist feedback
 16	 - Forward “ask about a team member” questions to the AI app via HTTP
 17	2) AI App (/ai): Python + FastAPI (API-only)
 18	 - Endpoints for ingestion and query
 19	 - Define RAG abstractions (vector store, embedder, pipeline) WITHOUT concrete implementations
 20	
 21	Do not build a UI. Everything is API-only.
 22	
 23	---
 24	
 25	### Non-Goals (for this iteration)
 26	- No business logic, no concrete integrations (Slack, HRIS, vector DB, LLM)
 27	- No migrations beyond minimal schema stubs
 28	- No auth/identity beyond placeholders
 29	- No infra/deployment scripts beyond simple run instructions
 30	- No error handling (skip for MVP)
 31	
 32	---
 33	
 34	### Architectural Principles
 35	- API-first: Define OpenAPI specs and DTOs before code
 36	- Separation of concerns and clean boundaries between /app and /ai
 37	- Event-driven shape: model a FeedbackCreated event and an ingestion trigger (HTTP call), even if the first version uses a simple synchronous call
 38	- Replaceable adapters: vector store and embedding providers must be behind interfaces/protocols
 39	- Readable, minimal, testable scaffolds
 40	
 41	---
 42	
 43	### Deliverables (Checklist)
 44	Provide these artifacts as code + docs, with TODOs and NotImplemented placeholders:
 45	- Overall repository layout scaffold
 46	- OpenAPI specs for both services
 47	- Controller/route stubs, DTOs, validators, error models
 48	- Domain model (entities/value objects) and repository/service interfaces
 49	- Event model (FeedbackCreated) and an Application Port interface for publishing/handling
 50	- AI app protocols: VectorStore, Embedder, RAGPipeline, IngestionService, QueryService
 51	- Persistence interface definitions only (no DB code)
 52	- Configuration placeholders and environment variable contract
 53	- Integration test scaffolds for both services (API level; mock external calls)
 54	- Minimal READMEs per service: how to run tests and start a dev server
 55

 135	
 136	### AI App (/ai) — API Contract (OpenAPI outline)
 137	Base path: /v1
 138	
 139	Ingestion
 140	- POST /ingest/member-corpus
 141	 - Body: IngestRequest { team_member_id: UUID, items: [FeedbackItem], from?: Instant, to?: Instant, wipe_existing: true }
 142	 - Semantics: replace existing corpus for member (MVP behavior)
 143	 - Response: 202 Accepted + operation id
 144	
 145	Query
 146	- POST /query
 147	 - Body: QueryRequest { team_member_id: UUID, question: String, from?: Instant, to?: Instant }
 148	 - Response: QueryResponse { answer: String, citations: [FeedbackRef], meta?: { used_filters } }
 149	
 150	Models
 151	- FeedbackItem(id: UUID, content: String, created_at: Instant)
 152	- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, created_at: Instant, snippet: String)
 153	
 154	Abstractions/Protocols (Python typing.Protocol or ABC)
 155	- VectorStore
 156	 - upsert_member_corpus(member_id: UUID, items: list[FeedbackItem], time_range?: (from, to)) -> None
 157	 - query(member_id: UUID, text: str, time_range?: (from, to), k: int=10) -> list[FeedbackRef]
 158	- Embedder
 159	 - embed_texts(texts: list[str]) -> list[list[float]]
 160	- RAGPipeline
 161	 - ingest(member_id, items, time_range?) -> None
 162	 - answer(member_id, question, time_range?) -> QueryResponse
 163	- IngestionService, QueryService: orchestrate via the above interfaces
 164	
 165	Filtering Strategy (design only)
 166	- Namespacing by team_member_id; time filters applied at query-time and/or precomputed shard keys; do not choose a concrete DB now
 167	
 168	Testing (integration scaffolds)
 169	- FastAPI TestClient (pytest) calling /ingest/member-corpus and /query
 170	- Provide fake/no-op implementations that raise NotImplementedError to ensure design compile-time integrity only
 171	
 172	---
 173	
 174	### Events & Integration Flow (Design Only)
 175	- On POST /feedback in /app: emit FeedbackCreated; application layer schedules/requests ingestion by calling AI App /ingest/member-corpus for that member (port method). Keep the call behind an interface; provide a stub implementation returning a fixed placeholder.
 176	
 177	---
 178	
 179	### Conventions & Guardrails
 180	- Kotlin 1.9+, Spring Boot 3.x; Python 3.11, FastAPI, Pydantic v2
 181	- Use clear package/module naming as shown above
 182	- All non-trivial methods contain TODO and throw UnsupportedOperationException (Kotlin) or raise NotImplementedError (Python)
 183	- No external network calls in tests

- Dropped error handling for the MVP in the prompt
- Made the /feedback and /ask flows generic with AI-based entity resolution, so team_member_id is not required

## Key prompt changes

- Non-Goals now explicitly include “No error handling (skip for MVP)”
- Software app scope: forward ask calls “without requiring a team_member_id; use AI-based entity resolution from free text”
- API contracts updated:
 - Feedback
 - POST /feedback now accepts FeedbackCreateDTO { content, created_at?, person_hint? }
 - GET /feedback supports member_ref? query that may be id/name/email; resolve via AI when ambiguous
 - Ask
 - POST /ask replaces /team-members/{id}/ask
 - Body: AskDTO { question, from?, to?, person_hint? }
- DTOs updated:
 - FeedbackCreateDTO(content, createdAt?, personHint?)
 - AskDTO(question, from?, to?, personHint?)
- Ports/Interfaces:
 - Added EntityResolutionService on the app side
 - AiClient.ask now accepts question, from?, to?, personHint?
- AI app:
 - Introduced EntityResolver protocol
 - Ingestion uses team_member_ref (id|name|email) and resolves if not an ID
 - Query accepts person_hint and returns resolved_member_id in meta
- Error Model section changed to “Skip for MVP”

## File updated
- docs/initial-prompt.md

Example excerpt:

<augment_code_snippet path="docs/initial-prompt.md" mode="EXCERPT">
```markdown
Ask (delegates to AI App)
- POST /ask
 - Body: AskDTO { question, from?, to?, person_hint? }
 - Returns: AskResponseDTO { answer, citations?: [FeedbackRef] }
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Would you like me to also adjust the MVP doc to note these endpoint shapes, or keep the changes confined to the prompt for now?

- In Python, a Protocol (from typing.Protocol) is like an interface: it defines the shape (method signatures) that a class must have, without providing an implementation.
- Any class that implements those methods is considered compatible, even if it doesn’t explicitly inherit from the Protocol. This is called structural typing or “duck typing” with static checking.

### Why we used Protocols in the ai module
- Decoupling: We declare the contracts for components like VectorStore, Embedder, EntityResolver, and RAGPipeline without tying the code to any specific library.
- Swapability: You can later plug in different implementations (e.g., different vector DBs or embedders) without changing the rest of the code.
- Design-first: It lets us ship the architecture and compile-time shape now, and fill in implementations later.

### Quick example from your file
This Protocol defines the “interface” for resolving a team member from text. Any class with a compatible resolve_member method matches it automatically.

<augment_code_snippet path="ai/helly_ai/domain/protocols.py" mode="EXCERPT">
```python
class EntityResolver(Protocol):
 def resolve_member(self, text: str, hint: Optional[str]) -> str: ...
```
</augment_code_snippet>

### How it compares to Abstract Base Classes (ABC)
- Protocols: Structural typing (no inheritance needed), great for flexible, pluggable components and static type checking.
- ABCs: Nominal typing (explicit inheritance required), can provide partial implementations and enforce abstract methods at runtime.

### Naming: “protocols” vs “interfaces” vs “ports”
- protocols.py emphasizes that these are Python typing.Protocol definitions.
- interfaces.py is also fine and often more familiar to engineers.
- ports.py aligns with DDD (Ports & Adapters), if you prefer a domain-driven naming style.

If you’d prefer, I can:
- Rename ai/helly_ai/domain/protocols.py to interfaces.py or ports.py
- Move the Pydantic models out to ai/helly_ai/domain/models.py so protocols.py only contains Protocols

Tell me your preference and I’ll update the structure.

Path: docs/product-vision.md
 1	# Helly AI
 2	
 3	Helly is your friendly people management assistant. 
 4	
 5	This system supports team leads, managers, and people ops in managing feedback, performance, 1:1s, and goals with the help of lightweight AI agents. The goal is to create a modular, proactive "second brain" for people management — one that can plug into existing HR tools or stand alone.
 6	
 7	---
 8	
 9	## Strategic Vision
 10	
 11	- **Build as a platform**: The core logic, memory, and agent behavior should be system-agnostic — easily integrated into tools like Lattice, BambooHR, Leapsome, etc.
 12	- **Composable AI agents**: Each capability is managed by an autonomous agent (e.g., FeedbackAgent, FollowUpAgent) that can run standalone or be embedded via API/webhook.
 13	- **Pluggable architecture**: Slack/Teams bots, web widgets, REST/gRPC interfaces — focus on integration rather than full-stack replacement.
 14	
 15	---
 16	
 17	## Core Use Cases
 18	
 19	### 1. **Feedback Catalog on the Go**
 20	- Write feedback any time (voice, text, Slack, etc.)
 21	- System tags person, date, topic, and sentiment automatically
 22	- Stores feedback in an ongoing timeline ("performance catalog")
 23	
 24	**AI Role:**
 25	- Extracts themes and tags
 26	- Detects praise vs concern
 27	- Suggests reframing if tone is harsh
 28	- Connects feedback to goals or 1:1 agendas
 29	
 30	---
 31	
 32	### 2. **Proactive Follow-ups**
 33	- Detects silence or imbalance ("You haven’t said anything about Max in 2 months")
 34	- Prompts for check-ins based on gaps or negative trends
 35	
 36	**AI Role:**
 37	- FollowUpAgent monitors interaction frequency
 38	- Nudges manager with lightweight prompts
 39	- Tracks omissions, not just activity
 40	
 41	---
 42	
 43	### 3. **1:1 Agenda Management**
 44	- Drafts agendas from recent feedback, goals, and loose ends
 45	- Reminds about unresolved issues, team dynamics, or goal blockers
 46	- Generates actionable talking points
 47	
 48	**AI Role:**
 49	- OneOnOneAgent analyzes recent data
 50	- Highlights urgent or time-sensitive items
 51	- Suggests framing or priority
 52	
 53	---
 54	
 55	### 4. **Goal Setting & Tracking**
 56	- Create SMART goals, link to feedback and actions
 57	- Track updates passively (via feedback, performance data)
 58	- Get reminders when progress is stalled
 59	
 60	**AI Role:**
 61	- GoalAgent helps define clear, aligned objectives
 62	- Monitors goal staleness or drift
 63	- Suggests next actions based on historical behavior
 64	
 65	---
 66	
 67	## Technical Design Principles
 68	
 69	- **Event-driven agents** with persistent memory (DB + embeddings)
 70	- **Modular agents** with clear boundaries and APIs:
 71	 - `FeedbackAgent`
 72	 - `FollowUpAgent`
 73	 - `OneOnOneAgent`
 74	 - `GoalAgent`
 75	- **Context-aware RAG**: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for summarizing past feedback, goals, 1:1s
 76	- **Interoperable I/O**:
 77	 - Slack, Teams, Email, Mobile input
 78	 - Expose APIs and webhooks for HRIS and PM system integration
 79	
 80	---
 81	
 82	## Sample Prompts / Interactions
 83	
 84	- "Log feedback for Max: took great ownership of the roadmap."
 85	- "Who haven’t I talked about lately?"
 86	- "What should I discuss with Lisa tomorrow?"
 87	- "Remind me to follow up on Alex’s new goal next week."
 88	- "Summarize Julia’s Q2 performance."
 89	
 90	---
 91	
 92	## Future Features (TBD)
 93	
 94	- Timeline view per person with feedback, goals, and 1:1s
 95	- Sentiment heatmaps for teams
 96	- Voice-to-feedback input with tagging
 97	- Shared vs private notes toggle
 98	- HRIS sync (e.g., BambooHR, HiBob, Personio)
 99	- Exportable review packets
 100	
 101	---
 102	
 103	## What’s Next
 104	
 105	- Define MVP loop (e.g. FeedbackAgent + FollowUpAgent)
 106	- Build memory backend (structured + vector)
 107	- Ship as Slackbot or web extension first
 108	- Focus on *one tight loop* that shows agent value...
Path: docs/mvp.md
 1	
 2	# MVP for Helly AI
 3	
 4	## Product spec
 5	
 6	Everything in the MVP is API only. We are not building a UI.
 7	
 8	### Setting up a team
 9	
 10	As a manager I need to define my team members. A team member needs to
 11	- Have a name (e.g. Max Muster)
 12	- Have a role (e.g. Lead engineer)
 13	- Have a relationship with me (e.g. reports to me, peer)
 14	- Have a start date
 15	
 16	### Adding feedback
 17	
 18	As a manager I can add feedback for a team member. Feedback needs to
 19	- Describe a specific situation or a note to remember. Examples 
 20	 - "Max took great ownership of the roadmap."
 21	 - "This week I felt like Max was not very communicative. I think we should have a chat."
 22	 - "I just heard that Max is feeling a bit burnt out. I should touch on that topic in the next call"
 23	
 24	### Asking about a team member
 25	
 26	As a manager I can ask questions about a team member. Examples
 27	- "What should I discuss with Max tomorrow?"
 28	- "What is Max's performance like?"
 29	- "What should I do next with Max?"
 30	- "I want to draft a feedback document for Max. Help me create a structure."
 31	
 32	## Tech spec
 33	
 34	### Software App
 35	
 36	The "classic" app, meaning regular code w/o AI should be in a separate package /app.
 37	This will include
 38	- The REST API
 39	- Database for keeping the feedback entries
 40	
 41	Basically a simple CRUD app.
 42	
 43	Tech stack for the software app:
 44	- Kotlin
 45	- Spring Boot
 46	- PostgreSQL
 47	
 48	### AI App
 49	
 50	The AI app will be in a separate package /ai.
 51	This is a standalone python application with its own API. The software app will call this API to get the AI generated responses.
 52	
 53	On a regular basis (e.g. when a new feedback entry is added, or on a time schedule) all the feedback needs to be
 54	inserted into a vector database that allows semantic search and conversational QA.
 55	For now, we will wipe & re-insert all the feedback data whenever a change is made. We can have a simple api that allows
 56	us to insert all the feedback data for a team member at once.
 57	
 58	Important: The vector data needs to be filtered by team member (e.g. the ID) and time period, potentially more criteria later.
 59	Choose an appropriate pattern to make this possible.
 60	
 61	### Testing
 62	
 63	We want to have integration tests at first that allow us to verify the end-to-end flow while keeping the exact implementation flexible.
 64	This means: test on an API level. Only mock external calls. 
 65	We want to test the software and ai apps separately.
 66	
 67	When this MVP is completed, it should only have a small set of tests that verify that most important use cases.
 68	
 69	### General guidelines
 70	
 71	- Favour readability always. Follow the clean code principles.
 72	- Separate concerns. 
 73	- Always think API-first. Define a clear API contract and stick to it. The API must be business-oriented, no technical details....

 11	### Scope
 12	Create two separable applications with clean boundaries:
 13	1) Software App (/app): Kotlin + Spring Boot + PostgreSQL
 14	 - Expose REST API for teams, team members, feedback CRUD
 15	 - Persist feedback

 83	### Software App (/app) — API Contract (OpenAPI outline)
 84	Base path: /v1
 85	
 86	Team Members
 87	- POST /team-members
 88	 - Body: { name, role, relationship_to_manager, start_date }
 89	 - Returns: TeamMemberDTO { id, ... }
 90	- GET /team-members/{id}
 91	- GET /team-members?search=
 92	
 93	Feedback
 94	- POST /feedback
 95	 - Body: FeedbackCreateDTO { team_member_id, content, created_at? }
 96	 - Behavior: persist; publish FeedbackCreated event; invoke AI ingestion sync endpoint for that member (through an application port; actual HTTP call stubbed)
 97	 - Returns: FeedbackDTO { id, team_member_id, content, created_at }
 98	- GET /feedback?team_member_id=&from=&to=
 99	
 100	Ask (delegates to AI App)
 101	- POST /team-members/{id}/ask
 102	 - Body: AskDTO { question, from?, to? }
 103	 - Returns: AskResponseDTO { answer, citations?: [FeedbackRef] }
 104	 - Implementation: controller -> application port -> stubbed AiClient; do not call a real server
 105	
 106	Error Model
 107	- Problem+JSON style: { type, title, status, detail, instance }
 108	
 109	DTOs (Kotlin data classes)
 110	- TeamMemberDTO(id: UUID, name: String, role: String, relationshipToManager: String, startDate: LocalDate)
 111	- FeedbackDTO(id: UUID, teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant)
 112	- FeedbackCreateDTO(teamMemberId: UUID, content: String, createdAt: Instant?)
 113	- AskDTO(question: String, from: Instant?, to: Instant?)
 114	- AskResponseDTO(answer: String, citations: List<FeedbackRef>?)
 115	- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, createdAt: Instant, snippet: String)
 116	
 117	Domain Model (no JPA yet; simple classes/interfaces)
 118	- TeamMember(id, name, role, relationshipToManager, startDate)
 119	- Feedback(id, teamMemberId, content, createdAt)
 120	- Event: FeedbackCreated(id, teamMemberId, createdAt)
 121	
 122	Ports/Interfaces
 123	- TeamMemberRepository, FeedbackRepository (CRUD method signatures only)
 124	- AiClient (ask(teamMemberId, question, from?, to?) -> AskResponseDTO; ingestAll(teamMemberId, items))
 125	- EventPublisher (publish(event: FeedbackCreated))
 126	- Use-cases: FeedbackService.addFeedback(...), AskService.ask(...)
 127	
 128	Testing (integration scaffolds)
 129	- SpringBootTest with MockMvc/WebTestClient
 130	- Tests cover: create member -> add feedback -> POST ask (AiClient mocked)
 131	- External calls mocked via a TestConfiguration bean
 132	
 133	---
 134	
 135	### AI App (/ai) — API Contract (OpenAPI outline)
 136	Base path: /v1
 137	
 138	Ingestion
 139	- POST /ingest/member-corpus
 140	 - Body: IngestRequest { team_member_id: UUID, items: [FeedbackItem], from?: Instant, to?: Instant, wipe_existing: true }
 141	 - Semantics: replace existing corpus for member (MVP behavior)
 142	 - Response: 202 Accepted + operation id
 143	
 144	Query
 145	- POST /query
 146	 - Body: QueryRequest { team_member_id: UUID, question: String, from?: Instant, to?: Instant }
 147	 - Response: QueryResponse { answer: String, citations: [FeedbackRef], meta?: { used_filters } }
 148	
 149	Models
 150	- FeedbackItem(id: UUID, content: String, created_at: Instant)
 151	- FeedbackRef(id: UUID, created_at: Instant, snippet: String)
 152	
 153	Abstractions/Protocols (Python typing.Protocol or ABC)
 154	- VectorStore
 155	 - upsert_member_corpus(member_id: UUID, items: list[FeedbackItem], time_range?: (from, to)) -> None
 156	 - query(member_id: UUID, text: str, time_range?: (from, to), k: int=10) -> list[FeedbackRef]
 157	- Embedder
 158	 - embed_texts(texts: list[str]) -> list[list[float]]
 159	- RAGPipeline
 160	 - ingest(member_id, items, time_range?) -> None
 161	 - answer(member_id, question, time_range?) -> QueryResponse
 162	- IngestionService, QueryService: orchestrate via the above interfaces
 163	
 164	Filtering Strategy (design only)
 165	- Namespacing by team_member_id; time filters applied at query-time and/or precomputed shard keys; do not choose a concrete DB now
 166	
 167	Testing (integration scaffolds)
 168	- FastAPI TestClient (pytest) calling /ingest/member-corpus and /query
 169	- Provide fake/no-op implementations that raise NotImplementedError to ensure design compile-time integrity only
 170	
 171	---
 172	
 173	### Events & Integration Flow (Design Only)
 174	- On POST /feedback in /app: emit FeedbackCreated; application layer schedules/requests ingestion by calling AI App /ingest/member-corpus for that member (port method). Keep the call behind an interface; provide a stub implementation returning a fixed placeholder.
 175	
 176	---
 177	
 178	### Conventions & Guardrails
 179	- Kotlin 1.9+, Spring Boot 3.x; Python 3.11, FastAPI, Pydantic v2
 180	- Use clear package/module naming as shown above
 181	- All non-trivial methods contain TODO and throw UnsupportedOperationException (Kotlin) or raise NotImplementedError (Python)
 182	- No external network calls in tests
 183	- Favor clean code and readability; keep files small and cohesive
 184

 193	- README.md in /app and /ai explaining how to run tests and servers locally

 170	- Provide fake/no-op implementations that raise NotImplementedError to ensure design compile-time integrity only
 171	
 172	---
 173	
 174	### Events & Integration Flow (Design Only)
 175	- On POST /feedback in /app: emit FeedbackCreated; application layer schedules/requests ingestion by calling AI App /ingest/member-corpus for that member (port method). Keep the call behind an interface; provide a stub implementation returning a fixed placeholder.
 176	
 177	---
 178	
 179	### Conventions & Guardrails
 180	- Kotlin 1.9+, Spring Boot 3.x; Python 3.11, FastAPI, Pydantic v2
 181	- Use clear package/module naming as shown above
 182	- All non-trivial methods contain TODO and throw UnsupportedOperationException (Kotlin) or raise NotImplementedError (Python)
 183	- No external network calls in tests
 184	- Favor clean code and readability; keep files small and cohesive
 185	
 186	---
 187	
 188	### Output Expectations
 189	Submit a PR-ready scaffold with:
 190	- The directory structure and files
 191	- OpenAPI specs (YAML) for both services
 192	- Source files with interfaces, DTOs, controllers/routers stubs, and comments
 193	- Test folders with 1–2 integration test skeletons per service
 194	- README.md in /app and /ai explaining how to run tests and servers locally
 195	
 196	Stop here. Do NOT implement business logic or concrete adapters. Surface any design questions as TODOs at top of relevant files.
